title: Stocks Climb on Factory Data as Gold Selloff Eases: Markets Wrap
description: Wall Street kicked off February with gains in stocks as solid factory data bolstered optimism about Corporate America while losses in gold and silver moderated after Fridayâ€™s dramatic rout. Bond yields rose alongside the dollar. The crypto world rebounded, with Bitcoin jumping.

title: Strategy slides after bitcoin briefly dips below crypto firm's key breakeven level
description: Bitcoin fell as low as about $74,500 early Monday, dipping below Strategy's average purchase price of $76,052 per token.

title: Is Bitcoin About to Get Hit by a Polar Vortex?
description: Bitcoin (BTC) has been ensnared in a brutal crypto winter since soaring to a peak above $126,000 in early October. The flash crash that hit just a few days later triggered a downward spiral, erasing gains amid mounting economic pressures and regulatory scrutiny.
